intro: Guzmania hygrometrica, commonly known as the water pineapple, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that collect water, forming a central pool. The plant produces striking inflorescences with colorful bracts that can range from red to orange. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires high humidity and well-draining soil. Guzmania hygrometrica is popular as a decorative plant due to its vibrant appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
